pullRequest.body:
Rename `halfspace` to `halfSpace`, treating `half` and `space` as two words. This conforms to the existing pattern in
* `EuclideanHalfSpace`
* `UpperHalfPlane`
* `HalfPlane.lean`

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ closure_halfSpace`
`+ closure_open_halfSpace`
`+ convex_halfSpace_ge`
`+ convex_halfSpace_gt`

`+ convex_halfSpace_im_gt`

`+ convex_halfSpace_re_lt`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>



</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
Is there a Zulip thread about this? It seems like that's in order for a decision like this.

@j-loreaux There isn't a Zulip chat yet, but I can create one if you think this is a non-trivial rename. There's already `EuclideanHalfSpace` and `HalfPlane`, so I think it make sense to conform `halfspace` to that pattern.
Please add the other examples (e.g., UpperHalfPlane, etc.) to the PR description. Since this is the only odd one out, it's fine to go without Zulip.
bors d+

:v: winstonyin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

:v: winstonyin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11811765780/job/32905880171)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11811765780/job/32905880410)

Thanks for the PR! This does what it should and does that well.
maintainer merge

I don't have a strong preference between "halfspace" and "halfSpace". I care that these are used consistently. Currently, mathlib mostly prefers the latter, so using that seems like a reasonable choice.

Thanks for the PR! This does what it should and does that well.
maintainer merge

I don't have a strong preference between "halfspace" and "halfSpace". I care that these are used consistently. Currently, mathlib mostly prefers the latter, so using that seems like a reasonable choice.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: rename `halfspace` to `halfSpace`

source.title: chore: rename a bunch of stuff

nodes.body:
Thanks for the PR! This does what it should and does that well.
maintainer merge

I don't have a strong preference between "halfspace" and "halfSpace". I care that these are used consistently. Currently, mathlib mostly prefers the latter, so using that seems like a reasonable choice.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
Is there a Zulip thread about this? It seems like that's in order for a decision like this.

@j-loreaux There isn't a Zulip chat yet, but I can create one if you think this is a non-trivial rename. There's already `EuclideanHalfSpace` and `HalfPlane`, so I think it make sense to conform `halfspace` to that pattern.
Please add the other examples (e.g., UpperHalfPlane, etc.) to the PR description. Since this is the only odd one out, it's fine to go without Zulip.
